intro: Comesperma laurifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and heathland environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
